Key Match Events: Brooklyn Nets opened the game with an 11-0 run
Philadelphia 76ers roared back to secure a 29-19 lead by the end of the first quarter
Caleb Martin took charge in the second quarter, scoring eight points to help the 76ers extend their lead to 64-47 heading into halftime
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Nets were without Ben Simmons due to left calf soreness
Others: Joel Embiid delivered a dominant performance with 28 points and 12 rebounds
Paul George supported Embiid with an impressive performance, finishing with 17 points, four rebounds, six assists and two steals
Tyrese Maxey added to the effort with 18 points and seven assists
Ziaire Williams, posted 19 points, three rebounds and two assists
Newly-acquired Nets guard D'Angelo Russell contributed five points, starting the scoring for both teams with a 27-foot three-pointer
Russell played just 14 minutes before exiting the game with a right shin contusion
